title: Formula
text: We know that to find if the function is increasing, constant, or decreasing we must find the slope. To do so, we can use our slope formula.
speech: We know that to find if the function is increasing, constant, or decreasing we must find the slope. To do so, we can use our slope formula.
pacedSpeech: We know that to find if the function is increasing, constant, or decreasing we must find the slope. To do so, we can use our slope formula.

title: Formula
text: The formula is (change in output)/(change in input).
speech: The formula is change in output over change in input.
pacedSpeech: The formula is change in output over change in input.

title: Plug in Values
speech: m is equal to fraction, 1 minus negative 2, over, 8 minus 3,
pacedSpeech: m is equal to fraction, 1 minus negative 2, over, 8 minus 3,

title: Solve
text: When we solve, we get $$\frac{3}{5}$$ as our slope
speech: When we solve, we get  3 fifths  as our slope
pacedSpeech: When we solve, we get   3 fifths

title: Checking for if function is increasing, decreasing, or constant.
text: We see that our slope is $$\frac{3}{5}$$, a positive number, which means our function is increasing.
speech: We see that our slope is  3 fifths , a positive number, which means our function is increasing.
pacedSpeech: We see that our slope is   3 fifths
, a positive number, which means our function is increasing.
